page.title: 01AN IMPRESSION OF CHARLBURY
page.content: Charlbury is an old market town in the Evenlode Valley. It is surrounded by small villages and hamlets,and is, itself,on the edge of Wychwood Forest. The local stone is a rich honey colour and was used for building the Cotswold stone houses we can see today. At nearby Stonesfield are quarries for Stonesfield slates which were used for roofing material from early times. Through the centre of this area run the railway line from Worcester to Oxford -the Cotswold Line-, and the River Evenlode. The landscape is undulating with woods,hedges and drystone walls all around.The impression is that this area is entirely rural. The population of Charlbury has grown quickly to about 4000,and new houses are on the outskirts of the town leaving the centre as it always was.
